info.description:
## Introduction The PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud REST API lets you manage your Advanced Identity Cloud tenants. The API exposes access management and identity management endpoints, with additional endpoints specific to Advanced Identity Cloud tenant environments.

We are now publishing the API spec in OpenAPI 3.0. For the legacy Swagger 2.0 spec, please download [swagger.yaml](swagger.yaml), but note that it may not contain all new functionality.

For full PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud documentation, please visit [the docs website](https://docs.pingidentity.com/pingoneaic/latest/). ## Authenticating to the API The PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud REST API has two different authentication methods: - [API key and secret](https://docs.pingidentity.com/pingoneaic/latest/developer-docs/authenticate-to-rest-api-with-api-key-and-secret.html): used for tenant read-only operations - [Access token](https://docs.pingidentity.com/pingoneaic/latest/developer-docs/authenticate-to-rest-api-with-access-token.html): used for access management operations, identity management operations or tenant write operations For a summary of how to use these authentication methods, refer to [Authenticate to Advanced Identity Cloud REST API](https://docs.pingidentity.com/pingoneaic/latest/developer-docs/authenticate-to-rest-api-overview.html).
info.title: PingOne Advanced Identity Cloud API

tags.name: Environment Secrets and Variables
tags.description: Environment secrets and variables (ESVs) let you individually configure the development, staging, and production environments in your Advanced Identity Cloud tenant.

tags.name: Variables
tags.description:
Variables are used to set configuration values that need to be different for each tenant environment. For example, an external service might need one URL in your development environment, but a different URL in your production environment.

Variables are not versioned, and can be read back. They should not contain secrets.

Variables are injected into Advanced Identity Cloud configuration when the underlying services are started or restarted.

tags.name: Secrets
tags.description:
Secrets are used to set configuration values that need encrypting. The values may or may not need to be different for each tenant environment. Authorization passwords and authentication signing keys are examples of secrets that might exist in your configuration.

Secrets can have multiple versions enabled to allow rotation, and once set they cannot be read back.

Secrets are injected into Advanced Identity Cloud configuration when the underlying services are started or restarted.

tags.name: Restart
tags.description: A restart of Advanced Identity Cloud services is used when new variables or secrets have been created and need to be injected into Advanced Identity Cloud configuration.

tags.name: Count
tags.description: Count is used to quickly identify how many variables and secrets are in an environment.

tags.name: Config Promotions
tags.description: Advanced Identity Cloud lets you run self-service promotions to move configuration between a sequential pair of tenant environments.

tags.name: Promotion
tags.description: API endpoints related to self-service promotions

tags.name: Environment Configuration
tags.description: Advanced Identity Cloud gives you the ability to configure various environment settings via REST.

tags.name: CSRs
tags.description: Operations related to certificate signing requests

tags.name: Content Security Policy
tags.description: Operations related to content security policy

tags.name: SSO Cookie
tags.description: Operations related to single sign-on cookies

get.description: Returns all certificates installed in the tenant.

post.description: Upload a new certificate to the tenant.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new certificate

delete.description: Deletes a certificate installed on the tenant. This certificate must be disabled before deletion will be allowed.

get.description: Returns information about a certificate installed on the tenant.

patch.description: Updates information about a certificate installed on the tenant. This can be used to enable / disable certificates.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the updated certificate

get.description: Returns current enforced content security policy
Returns current report-only content security policy
Returns current cookie domains
Get count of ESV secrets and variables in the environment.
Returns all certificate signing requests created in the environment

post.description: Create a new certificate signing request

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new certificate signing request

delete.description: Deletes a CSR created in the tenant.

get.description: Returns information about a CSR created in the tenant.

patch.description: Upload a certificate to complete a CSR request, installing the certificate in the tenant. Only the `certificate` field can be set on an upload request.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new certificate signing request

get.description: Returns current custom domains
Returns current federation enforcement settings

put.description: Specify which admin groups are required to use federation

requestBody.description: Enforcement settings to apply to the tenant

post.description: Starts the lock process on the lower and upper environments

202.description: Lock has started on the environment

delete.description: Start the unlock process on the lower and upper environments.

202.description: Unlock has started on the environment

409.description: Environment is currently locking or unlocking

get.description: Get the lock status of the lower and upper environments.

parameters.description: If set to true this parameter will only return the lock status of the environment the request is aimed at
parameters.name: localLockOnly

200.description: Current status of lock on the environment

get.description: Get the status of a promotion, if one is in progress.

post.description: Promote configuration from the lower environment to the upper environment.

requestBody.description: A request body with info required to initiate a promotion

409.description: Promotion request is conflicting with the current state of the environment. For example, the environment is not locked, or a promotion or rollback is already running.

get.description: This will return the contents of the last run config promotion report
Get a specific promotion report.

404.description: report not found for given id

get.description: Get a provisional report of changes since the last time the lower environment was promoted to the upper environment. The report generated is for informational purposes only and may not reflect all the changes in a full promotion. A dry-run promotion is always recommended prior to a full promotion between environments.
Get a provisional rollback report of changes when we rollback the configuration to the previous promotion.
Get a list of previous promotion reports in date order.

post.description: Rollback the most recent configuration promotion.

requestBody.description: A request body with info required to initiate a rollback

409.description: Rollback request is conflicting with the current state of the environment. For example, the environment is not locked, or a promotion or rollback is already running.

get.description: Get release information
Get all secrets, but not their secret versions or secret version values.

delete.description: Delete a secret and all its secret versions and secret version values.

get.description: Get a secret, but not its secret versions or secret version values.

put.description: Create a secret and its first secret version.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new secret

get.description: Get all versions and version metadata of a secret. It is not possible to view the secret values.
get.summary: Get all versions of a secret

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new secret version

post.summary: Create a new version of a secret

delete.summary: Delete a version of a secret

get.description: Get a version and version metadata of a secret. It is not possible to view the secret value.
get.summary: Get a version of a secret

post.description: Update the status of a version of a secret to either ENABLED or DISABLED. The latest version of a secret cannot be updated to a status of DISABLED.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new status of the secret version

post.summary: Update the status of a version of a secret

get.description: Returns current SSO cookie configuration

post.description: Reset SSO cookie configuration to default

parameters.description: Reset SSO cookie configuration to default
parameters.name: _action

requestBody.description: SSO cookie configuration to apply to the tenant

get.description: Get restart status indicating whether any upgrade or rollout restart is taking place on Advanced Identity Cloud services.

post.description: Initiate restart of Advanced Identity Cloud services. This will inject any new variables or secrets into Advanced Identity Cloud configuration.

put.description: Create or update a variable using a predefined name. Once created, a variable name cannot be changed.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the new variable

PageCookie.description: Opaque data used for paging result data, can be used for paging instead of having to track pageSize and pagedResultsOffset
PageCookie.name: _pagedResultsCookie

PageOffset.description: Offset of the first result to be returned by endpoint
PageOffset.name: _pagedResultsOffset

PageSize.description: Maximum number of results returned by endpoint before paging
PageSize.name: _pageSize

X-ForgeRock-TransactionId.description: Permits setting a specific transaction ID for this request
X-ForgeRock-TransactionId.name: ForgeRock-Transaction-ID

esvOnlyPending.description: _Accept-API-Version: resource=2.0_ only, returns ESVs with unapplied changes
esvOnlyPending.name: _onlyPending

esvPageSize.description: _Accept-API-Version: resource=2.0_ only, maximum number of results returned by endpoint before paging
esvPageSize.name: _pageSize

esvPagedResultsCookie.description: _Accept-API-Version: resource=2.0_ only, opaque data used for paging result data, can be used for paging instead of having to track pageSize and pagedResultsOffset
esvPagedResultsCookie.name: _pagedResultsCookie

esvPagedResultsOffset.description: _Accept-API-Version: resource=2.0_ only, offset of the first result to be returned by endpoint
esvPagedResultsOffset.name: _pagedResultsOffset

scopes.fr:idc:certificate:read: Read only access to certificates configuration
scopes.fr:idc:content-security-policy:*: Full access to content security policy configuration
scopes.fr:idc:custom-domain:*: Full access to custom domains configuration
scopes.fr:idc:esv:restart: Perform a restart of the ID Cloud workloads
scopes.fr:idc:promotion:*: Allows a user to trigger a promotion
scopes.fr:idc:sso-cookie:*: Full access to SSO cookie configuration
scopes.fr:idm:*: Grants full ESV access if user has openidm-admin role

name.description: The canonical name of the domain to be validated.

active.description: The active status of the certificate. Set this to true for the certificate to be made live on the loadbalancer.

expireTime.description: The expiry time of the certificate. Not used in insert requests.

id.description: The unique identifier for the certificate resource. Not used in insert requests.

issuer.description: The issuer DN of the certificate

live.description: The live status of the certificate. This is automatically set by the system and indicates if the certificate is currently live externally.

subject.description: The subject DN of the certificate

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Domains associated by with the certificate via the Subject Alternative Name extension. The common name should be included in the SANs as well. Not used in insert requests.

validFromTime.description: The notBefore time of the certificate.

algorithm.description: The algorithm for the private key. The encryption algorithm will either be RSA-2048 or ECDSA P-256 depending on the algorithm choice. The default is RSA-2048.

certificateID.description: The ID of the certificate created from this CSR if the CSR has been completed.

id.description: The unique identifier for the CSR

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Additional domain or domains that the SSL certificate is securing

active.description: The active status of the certificate. Set this to true for the certificate to actively be served.

privateKey.description: The private key for the certificate. For security reasons, only insert requests include this field.

algorithm.description: The algorithm for the private key. The encryption algorithm will either be RSA-2048 or ECDSA P-256 depending on the algorithm choice. The default is RSA-2048.

businessCategory.description: Category of business, such as "Private Organization", Government Entity, Business Entity, or Non-Commercial Entity. Relevant for EV certificates.

commonName.description: Domain name that the SSL certificate is securing

jurisdictionCity.description: This field contains only information relevant to the Jurisdiction of Incorporation or Registration. Relevant for EV certificates.

jurisdictionCountry.description: This field contains only information relevant to the Jurisdiction of Incorporation or Registration. Relevant for EV certificates.

jurisdictionState.description: This field contains only information relevant to the Jurisdiction of Incorporation or Registration. Relevant for EV certificates.

serialNumber.description: The Registration (or similar) Number assigned to the Subject by the Incorporating or Registration Agency in its Jurisdiction of Incorporation or Registration. Relevant for EV certificates.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Additional domain or domains that the SSL certificate is securing

adminDiscoveryEndpoint.description: The OIDC well-known endpoint for the PingOne environment where admin identities exist

consumerDiscoveryEndpoint.description: The OIDC well-known endpoint for the PingOne consumer environment being linked

pingOneAdminJwksEndpoint.description: The JWKS endpoint for the dynamically-registered admin client

ssoAppId.description: The client ID to use in the PingOne IDP definition for SSO

active.description: The active status of the certificate. Set this to true for the certificate to actively be served.

certificate.description: The matching signed certificate for the request. This should only be set on update requests to upload the certificate.

esvVariableListV1.description: Variable list response when requested with empty Accept-API-Version or Accept-API-Version: resource=1.0

esvVariableListV2.description: Variable list response when requested with Accept-API-Version: resource=2.0

message.example: Environment is not in locked state

type.description: Either promotion or rollback depending on whether the report was for a config promotion or a config rollback

promoter.description: The name of the admin user who requested the promotion

promotionDescription.description: Promoter specified note to make it easier for them to identify what was promoted

type.description: Either promotion or rollback depending on whether the report was for a config promotion or a config rollback
Either promotion or rollback depending on whether the report was for a config promotion or a config rollback

dryRun.description: A boolean denoting whether this a dry run

ignoreEncryptedSecrets.description: A boolean denoting whether or not to ignore encrypted secrets detected in config during the promotion

promoter.description: The name of the admin user who initiated the promotion

promotionDescription.description: Promoter specified note to make it easier for them to identify what was promoted

unlockEnvironmentsAfterPromotion.description: A boolean denoting whether or not to automatically unlock the environments after a successful promotion

zendeskTicketReference.description: A string denoting the Zendesk ticket reference to be added to the promotion commit message

promoter.description: The name of the admin user who initiated the promotion

promotionDescription.description: Promoter specified note to make it easier for them to identify what was promoted

unlockEnvironmentsAfterPromotion.description: A boolean denoting whether or not to automatically unlock the environments after a successful promotion

zendeskTicketReference.description: A string denoting the Zendesk ticket reference to be added to the promotion commit message

ContentSecurityPolicy.description: Enforced content security policy to apply to the tenant
